intro: Luma grisebachii, commonly known as the purple luma, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Luma grisebachii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at higher elevations.
